alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 5:56PM EDT until April 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL LEXINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 555 PM EDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Red Bank, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornado will be near... Cayce, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam and South Congaree around 600 PM EDT. West Columbia, Springdale, Oak Grove, Pine Ridge and Columbia Metro Airport around 605 PM EDT. Columbia, St. Andrews, Riverbanks Zoo, Columbia International University, West Columbia Riverwalk, Five Points, SC State Fair Grounds and Harbison State Forest around 610 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Seven Oaks, Olympia, Rosewood, Gilbert, Edmund, Cayce Riverwalk, Camp Kinard, Eau Claire, Guignard Park and Steedman. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 38 and 68. Interstate 26 between mile markers 101 and 117. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 7. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately. This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
